meanings.definition: The interpretation of a text (as of the Bible) by reading into it one's own ideas.
meanings.sent1: During the discussion, the teacher explained how eisegesis can lead to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: Scholars caution against eisegesis when studying ancient texts.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his eisegesis of the menu led him to order a salad instead of a steak.
meanings.sent4: Her eisegesis of the painting transformed the abstract shapes into recognizable faces.
meanings.sent5: The detective's eisegesis of the cryptic message revealed the hidden code.

meanings.definition: The process of interpreting a text in such a way as to introduce one's own presuppositions, agendas, or biases.
meanings.sent1: The politician's eisegesis of the report skewed the facts to fit his narrative.
meanings.sent2: Academic integrity requires avoiding eisegesis in research papers.
meanings.sent3: The eisegesis of the weather forecast predicted a snowstorm in the middle of summer.
meanings.sent4: Her eisegesis of the map led her on a wild goose chase instead of the treasure hunt.
meanings.sent5: The artist's eisegesis of the sculpture brought out hidden meanings in the artwork.
